item.title: Best Clash Royale Dark Elixir Decks (2025)
item.description:
As Season 71 Undead March nears its end, Clash Royale players are again treated to the chaotic return of the Dark Elixir Event. The arena is filled once more with pools of dark elixir that randomly spawn and give all nearby troops a buff, turning every match into a fast-paced fight to the end.

Since you can't predict where the dark elixirs will appear, there's definitely some luck involved. But if you really want to stack up wins in this event, you need to bring the right deck to the challenge. In this guide, we'll go over some of the best decks in Clash Royale that are perfect for this game mode.

Best Dark Elixir Decks in Clash Royale

The main gimmick of the Dark Elixir event is that you'll see random pools of dark elixir spawning in the arena during the match. Any troop standing inside the pool will gain a rage buff, drastically boosting their attack and movement speed.

As the match progresses, the spawn rate of the dark elixir increases, creating more chaos in the arena. If your opponent manages to get a healthy unit onto your tower while standing in a dark elixir pool, your tower can melt in seconds. This makes timing and troop placement crucial, as a single mistake can easily cost you the game.

The Tower Troop doesn't get the buff from the dark elixir.

Here are some of the best decks in Clash Royale for the Dark Elixir event:

  • Double Witch Cannon Cart
  • Mega Knight Prince Wall Breakers
  • Mega Knight Mortar Skeleton Barrel

You'll find more information about these decks below.

Double Witch Cannon Cart

Card Name

Elixir Cost

Evo Bats

2

Evo Witch

5

Suspicious Bush

2

Goblins

2

Barbarian Barrel

2

Earthquake

3

Mother Witch

4

Cannon Cart

5

This deck relies on the deadly synergy between the Evo Witch and Mother Witch. The Evo Witch's faster Skeleton spawn rate with the dark elixir buff makes her a nightmare to deal with. The Mother Witch, on the other hand, constantly turns enemy troops into Cursed Hogs, adding another layer of pressure on your opponent.

Despite all the nerfs, the Cannon Cart is still a solid defensive unit that can take down tanks and kick off a counterpush. Cards like Suspicious Bush and Earthquake give you an alternate way to chip down enemy towers, while Goblins, Barbarian Barrel, and Bats support both offensively and defensively.

Mega Knight Prince Wall Breakers

Card Name

Elixir Cost

Evo Wall Breakers

2

Evo Mega Knight

7

Zap

2

Bandit

3

Goblin Gang

3

Arrows

3

Archer Queen

5

Prince

5

If you prefer more of a bridge-spam playstyle, this is the perfect deck for you. Evo Wall Breakers are ridiculously strong in the Dark Elixir event. When raged up, it's pretty much impossible to react to the Wall Breakers before they get on the tower. Add Evo Mega Knight to the mix, and you've got a strong response to any swarm cards, along with a scary counterpush.

The Prince is great for punishing overcommitments, and the Archer Queen gives you strong air-control. Bandit and Goblin Gang serve as your key defensive cards, applying constant pressure between big pushes. Zap and Arrows are your two spells that offer excellent value for their elixir cost.

Mega Knight Mortar Skeleton Barrel

Card Name

Elixir Cost

Evo Archers

2

Evo Mega Knight

7

Barbarian Barrel

2

Knight

3

Skeleton Barrel

3

Earthquake

3

Mortar

4

Inferno Tower

5

This deck combines strong defense and relentless chip damage. The win conditions here are Mortar and Skeleton Barrel, both of which can dish out huge damage if ignored, especially when they get the dark elixir buff.

Evo Mega Knight is your main line of defense that can help you kickstart powerful counterattacks. Meanwhile, Evo Archer provides long-range DPS against decks that rely on air cards such as Lava Hound or Balloons. Knight, Inferno Tower, and Barbarian Barrel are your primary defensive units in this deck.

All three of these decks use the Tower Princess Tower Troop.

The Dark Elixir event in Clash Royale adds a fun little twist to the standard game mode. It's extremely chaotic, and one misstep can cost you the entire tower. Feel free to try out these decks and let us know how they worked out for you.

item.title: Pokemon Scarlet & Violet - Mightiest Mark Garchomp Black Tera Raid Guide
item.description:
In Pokemon Scarlet & Violet , players can discover Tera Crystals around the open map as they travel from one location to another. By interacting with these Tera Crystals, you can trigger battles with randomized Terastallized Pokemon to potentially capture them and earn numerous other rewards. This has made Tera Raids one of the most popular ways to not only farm for valuable resources such as EXP Candies, but also to capture powerful Pokemon and potentially a rare Tera Type.

During the months of May and June, 2025, Pokemon Scarlet & Violet are hosting an in-game event involving Garchomp. During this time, players are more likely to encounter a special Garchomp at Black Crystal Tera raids that will come with a Mightiest Mark. These are rare Pokemon that can only be captured once per save, making them a popular collectible for gamers. If you're looking to prepare for this Mightiest Mark Garchomp encounter, all the information you will need has been outlined in the guide below.

Pokemon GO: Mightiest Mark Garchomp Black Tera Event

In Pokemon Scarlet & Violet , the in-game Mightiest Mark Garchomp event was live between the dates of Thursday, May 22, 2025, at 5 PM PDT to Sunday, May 25, 2025, at 4:59 PM PDT , then will be returning from Thursday, May 29, 2025, at 5:00 PM PDT to Sunday, June 1, 2025, at 4:59 PM PDT . To participate, players will need to locate and search Black Tera Crystals around their map until they locate one that presents a Garchomp battle.

This unique Garchomp can only be caught once per save file. If you previously captured it during a past Tera Raid Battle event, you won’t be able to catch it again. However, you can still join Tera Raid Battles against this Garchomp to earn other rewards, even if you’ve already added it to your collection.

How to Unlock Black Crystal Tera Raids

While players can encounter these Tera Crystals in the wild, they will need to meet some prerequisites in order for them to show up around the map. First, players will need to beat the Scarlet and Violet main story and Academy Ace Tournament. Doing so will unlock 5-Star Tera Raids, which you should then head to and start farming for a while. After completing a few Raids at this level, players will then unlock 6 and 7-Star Tera Raids, meaning Black Tera Crystals will now show up.

Garchomp Weaknesses, Resistances, & Best Counters, Explained

In Pokemon Scarlet & Violet , Garchomp is a Dragon and Ground Dual Type. With this Type combination, Garchomp is Resistant to Poison, Rock, Fire, and Electric Types. In particular, it is immune to Electric Type attacks, so players should avoid utilizing such monsters at all costs. On the other hand, Garchomp is weak to Fairy or Dragon, and Ice Types - taking double damage from Ice moves. However, this Gaerchomp has a Ground Tera Type, meaning Water and Grass Pokemon also become much more viable than usual for different purposes, too.

If you want to give yourself the best chance at taking down this powerful foe, you may wish to consider bringing some of the best possible counters to these Raid battles. Some of the most optimal choices have been outlined in the list below:

  • Stellar Tera Type Sinistcha
  • Orthworm
  • Intimidator Wo-Chien
  • Avalugg
  • Meadow Plate Arceus
  • Arboliva with Grassy Terrain
  • Special Attacker Gogoat
  • Skill Swap Malamar
  • Pelipper
  • Slowbro

item.title: Cyberpunk 2077 Player Meticulously Recreates GTA 6 Screenshots
item.description:
Summary

  • Player recreates GTA 6 screenshots in Cyberpunk 2077.
  • Although not intended to compare graphics, the images show how advanced GTA 6's visuals will be.
  • Grand Theft Auto 6 will release on May 26, 2026.

A dedicated Cyberpunk 2077 player has taken the time to recreate some of the most iconic Grand Theft Auto 6 screenshots, which were released alongside Trailer 2 earlier this month. Although this individual has used a handful of mods to match the shots as closely as possible, the images show just how advanced the visuals in Grand Theft Auto 6 are going to be when compared to other modern-day, triple-A titles.

On May 6, Rockstar Games shocked the world when it released the record-breaking second trailer for Grand Theft Auto 6 . In just 24 hours, the trailer accumulated over 475 million views across all social media platforms. According to Rockstar, this makes it the biggest and fastest-growing trailer in the history of the internet. While fans still have a year left to go until the game's release, the almost three minutes worth of footage and 70 new screenshots are keeping fans occupied for the time being. There has already been a myriad of discovered easter eggs and references, but now players are comparing the images to other triple-A titles, such as Cyberpunk 2077.

GTA 6 Screenshots Recreated in Cyberpunk 2077

There's no denying that CD Projekt Red's Cyberpunk 2077 is already one of the best-looking games around, but new comparison images from Reddit user Party-Scallion-189 show that Grand Theft Auto 6 is going to be leaps and bounds ahead of most other triple-A titles. The images, which can be seen below, use Cyberpunk 2077 's Panam as a stand-in for Lucia, recreating some of GTA 6 's best screenshots. From Lucia being mid-strike to gracefully relaxing in the pool, the Reddit user has spent the time recreating every detail from the screenshots. However, it is worth noting that a handful of mods were used to adjust the lighting, poses, effects, and customization in order to get the perfect shots.

While the user also notes that these images were not created to be a direct graphics comparison, it's hard not to appreciate just how impressive Grand Theft Auto 6 's visuals are. As both of the game's trailers have been created in-engine, the visuals seen are an accurate representation of what will appear in-game. Rockstar has also revealed that there were equal parts cutscenes and gameplay in Grand Theft Auto 6 Trailer 2, but did not specify which parts were gameplay. Users then spent the time rewatching the trailer and breaking down what parts could potentially be gameplay.

Unfortunately, it's going to be quite some time until fans get to check out Grand Theft Auto 6 's graphics in real-time. Shortly before Rockstar released the game's second trailer, the studio announced that it had delayed Grand Theft Auto 6 from its Fall 2025 release window to May 26, 2026. In a statement on its social media channels, Rockstar apologized to fans and noted that the studio's goal "has always been to try and exceed expectations." With Grand Theft Auto 6 being no exception to that rule, Rockstar said it needs the extra time to deliver the level of quality that fans have grown to expect from the developer.

item.title: Hands-On Preview for Dragon Quest 1 & 2 HD-2D Remake
item.description:
During PAX East 2025 earlier this month (May), Game Rant had the opportunity to sit down with Square Enix and play a couple of minutes of the upcoming HD-2D Remakes of Dragon Quest 1 and Dragon Quest 2 . The remake of the third game was released last year and was developed by ARTDINK and Square Enix, marking the start of the Erdrick Trilogy. You see, chronologically, the third Dragon Quest is the first in the timeline, and the other two occur after it.

This gameplay session was split between the remakes, so I didn't get too much hands-on time with these classic JRPGs, but the one thing that stood out to me after playing was that somehow the HD-2D treatment that Square Enix has cooked up looks better than anything that has come before it. Octopath Traveler 1 and Dragon Quest 3 HD-2D Remake pale in comparison to the beauty that is in Dragon Quest 1 and 2 HD-2D Remake .

From the jaw-dropping water effects to the visuals of the world map to the way the lighting looks when you're walking through a dungeon with a torch, these games look really good. And maybe it was because I was sitting mere inches away from a 4K television hooked up to a PS5, but I was absolutely mesmerized by the graphical detail of the worlds of both games.

Dragon Quest 1 and 2 HD-2D Remake Preview

A Collection of Gorgeous, Iconic JRPGS

Now, I haven't played too many Dragon Quest games in my day. However, from what I can tell, these two remakes (and the one that came before it) are still giving players that classic Dragon Quest treatment of random encounters, old-style medieval dialog, and cheery music amidst a somewhat dark world. The graphical style is getting overhauled, of course, but there's not much there in terms of quality-of-life stuff.

One of the new things that the Square Enix PR people pointed out to me during the preview is that, previously, you were only able to fight against one enemy at a time in Dragon Quest 1 . There's only one character in your party in that game, but now you'll be able to fight against multiple monsters. As far as Dragon Quest 2 goes, you actually recruit characters to your party throughout the story, so not much is changing there.

So, for those who have fond memories of these games as a child, you'll be happy to know that the experience you remember will hopefully be the same in these remakes, but just more realized. And for those who have been on the fence about diving into the vast franchise that is Dragon Quest , it seems the HD-2D remakes are one of the best ways to start. It's a gorgeous version of some of the most iconic JRPGs of all time that have gone on to influence so many other video games.

(Game Rant's preview of Dragon Quest 1 & 2 HD-2D Remake was done on a PlayStation 5.)

item.title: The Wait for Destiny 2’s The Edge of Fate Expansion Keeps Getting Easier
item.description:
Summary

  • Rite of the Nine offers top-tier legendary weapons like Cruel Mercy and Inquisitor.
  • Iron Banner Scout Rifle Nature Reclaimed is a must-have for players before The Edge of Fate expansion.
  • Rite of the Nine event uncovers lore on the Nine, tying into the upcoming Fate saga in Destiny 2.

Now that the decade-long Light and Darkness saga is coming to an end in Destiny 2 , the next chapter of the franchise’s ongoing story is fast approaching. Set to release on July 15, The Edge of Fate expansion for Destiny 2 will kick off the Fate saga and the Year of Prophecy, taking both the franchise’s sandbox and storytelling into an exciting new era. Although the release of The Edge of Fate isn’t far off by now, all of the latest and upcoming events going on in Destiny 2 are helping to make the wait for this expansion even easier.

With a major expansion on the horizon and the Episode Heresy story ending, players might feel inclined to take a break from Destiny 2 until The Edge of Fate expansion releases. However, between now and when this expansion arrives, there are several worthwhile opportunities for players to earn some top-tier legendary loot in Destiny 2 , giving players the perfect chance to expand their arsenal and max out on endgame currencies just in time for the release of The Edge of Fate expansion.

How Destiny 2 is Making the Wait for The Edge of Fate Expansion Worth It

  • The Rite of the Nine limited-time event serves as the introduction to The Edge of Fate expansion, and also offers top-tier legendary weapons, among other rare rewards
  • The Cruel Mercy pulse rifle and The Inquisitor shotgun, including their Adept versions, are available as bonus legendary weapon drops from completing Nightfall and Trials of Osiris activities
  • Iron Banner limited-time PvP event returns with a new reward
  • Episode Revenant Loot Tonics and the Episode Heresy Tome of Want provide ways to target specific loot drops while playing any activity

Why Players Shouldn’t Sleep on Destiny 2’s Rite of the Nine Event

Throughout Destiny 2 ’s Rite of the Nine event, one of three dungeons will be featured each week, with varying difficulty levels that offer increasingly better rewards, which notably include rare Adept and Holofoil legendary weapons, as well as an exclusive Shader, emblems, and several IRL collector’s items. Even amidst all the weapon and armor changes coming to Destiny 2 in The Edge of Fate expansion, it’ll likely be a long time before the god-roll legendary weapons from this event are power-crept and replaced by a new meta, if ever, so it’s highly recommended for players to grab these weapons before they’re gone.

Not only does the Rite of the Nine event offer exclusive, top-tier versions of the legendary weapons from the Dungeons featured in this activity, but there are also new secret collectibles hidden throughout this event that allow players to uncover the lore surrounding Orin, the Emissary of the Nine. Ultimately, this context surrounding the Nine could prove to be useful, given that The Edge of Fate expansion will heavily involve this mysterious faction.

Players can participate in the Rite of the Nine event without needing to own the associated Dungeon Keys in Destiny 2 .

Destiny 2’s New Iron Banner Scout Rifle is a Must-Have

With the return of Iron Banner from May 20-27, there is a new legendary weapon to earn from this event: Nature Reclaimed. This Solar, lightweight frame scout rifle can notably roll with heal-clip and other perks that can compete with the current meta for legendary weapons in Destiny 2 , which makes for a fine addition to players’ collections. Aside from the new scout rifle, another reason to participate in Iron Banner is that this PvP event also allows players to double-dip and earn reputation and exclusive rewards from both Iron Banner and Crucible simultaneously.

Iron Banner will return on June 17-24, which will be the final run of this event before The Edge of Fate expansion releases.

Dive into the world of Destiny 2 to explore the mysteries of the solar system and experience responsive first-person shooter combat. Unlock powerful elemental abilities and collect unique gear to customize your Guardian's look and playstyle. Enjoy Destiny 2’s cinematic story, challenging co-op missions, and a variety of PvP modes alone or with friends. Download for free today and write your legend in the stars.

An Immersive Story
You are a Guardian, defender of the Last City of humanity in a solar system under siege by infamous villains. Look to the stars and stand against the darkness. Your legend begins now.

Guardian Classes
Choose from the armored Titan, mystic Warlock, or swift Hunter.
